titleStmt.title: On, On the Same, Ye Jocund Twain
a machine readable transcription

availability.p: The text of the original document is in the public domain. Subject to certain exceptions, public domain works may be freely copied or used in the creation of derivative works without permission, or authorization, of the former copyright owners.

The text encoding was created and/or prepared by the Walt Whitman Archive and is governed by a Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License (CC BY 4.0). Permission to reproduce the graphic images of the original item has been granted by the owners of the original for this publication only.

note.p: Heavily revised draft, approximately fourteen lines, of "On, on the Same, Ye Jocund Twain!," a poem first published in Good-Bye My Fancy in 1891.

bibl.author: Whitman, Walt

bibl.note: Transcribed from digital images of the original.

head.hi: On, on the same, ye jocund twain!

lg.l: On, on awhilethe same, ye jocund twain!

My life and verse ‸recitative, combining birth, and youth,
and mid– years,

Fitful as tongues of flame inseparably twined and
‸motley⹀ merged inof one;

My single soul-aims, confirmations,‸futures, joys— lights—nor
single soul alone,

My nation's crucial timestage (America's, haply
humanity's,)—its trial great and victory great,

Today's ‸My land's ecclairecissement of all the past, the
eastern world, old times,ancient medieval,

Here from their wanderings, strayings, lessons, wars
— here at the west at last triumphant!

A glad some pealing cry — a song of pride and
satisfaction!

I chant the ‸common bulk, thehorde ‸the general average ‸horde, (the best
no sooner than the worst)— I chant old age,

(My verses, madesung ‸written out) first) for early life, and through
mid–span,‸the summer's and autumn's spread.

I leap forpass to snow–white hairs the same, and give to
pulses winter—cool'd the same:)

l.del:
Through peace and war, ye twain — On, on, awhile. through many
problems, curious idle meditations, ‸yet, and now —

lg.l: And now, ‸in careless chant, the myself old age of me, with ‸faith and love
Waftesing to finishing stages,other work — changes, ‸unknown conditions, joys, just the same,
On, on, ye jocund twain! on, ‸continue on, the same!
